newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada spot gas continues upward trend, B.C. soars.
newsitem.headline: Canada spot gas continues upward trend, B.C. soars.

text.p: Canadian spot natural gas prices continued their across-the-board rise in brisk trade on Wednesday, with British Columbia markets leading the way amid high California demand and tight supply, traders said.
"Any gas that can go west is going west," said a harried Calgary-based trader.

Most players in the B.C. market, which until last week was the site of rock-bottom prices for well over a year, said they were not shocked at current levels, but surprised by how quickly prices ran up over the past week.

Gas for export at the Huntington/Sumas export border on the west coast was quoted as high as US$1.96 per million British thermal units, a dramatic 64-cent jump from last week. Gas at Westcoast Energy's Compressor Station 2 was quoted as high as C$2 per gigajoule, up nearly 60 cents.
"There's another cold front predicted (for the West Coast) next week, so I don't see much downside from here," said a Vancouver-based trader.

AECO gas was also pushed up thanks to western demand, marketers said. Gas at the Alberta storage hub was discussed at C$1.42/1.44 per GJ, up a dime from last week. November gas was fetching C#$1.41 up by as high as five cents. -- Reuters Calgary Bureau 403 531-1624
